page.title: 02FOX HUNTING IN WARWICKSHIRE
page.content: The horses were standing impatiently in front of the manor eagerly waiting to follow the hounds across the fields and hills.The hounds were barking excitedly to chase and then kill the poor fox.The riders were wearing blazing red jackets,white shirts,black ties,black riding hats,fawn coloured trousers and riding boots.They were talking to each other when a long brass horn blew and then they were off.First the hounds went then the horses and riders.First a trot and then a canter. Then they disappeared up the hills.Five minutes later we could see them,the hounds mingling with the horses then they went over a hill and were out of sight. Many of the people I have spoken to disagree with fox hunting as a sport.
